title: Reeling Raiders fire Kelly amid first year as OC
content: Chip Kelly is out as the offensive coordinator of the Raiders, a decision that came after the team's 24-10 loss to the Browns.

title: Mayfield sprains left shoulder in loss; MRI next
content: Buccaneers QB Baker Mayfield sprained his non-throwing shoulder in Sunday night's 34-7 loss to the Rams and will undergo an MRI on Monday.

title: Sanders shines in first start; Browns mum on QB1
content: Shedeur Sanders became the first Browns quarterback to win his first NFL start since 1995, snapping a 17-game losing streak.

title: Rams take over NFC's top seed; now SB favorites
content: As a result of their 34-7 win over the Buccaneers on Sunday, Matthew Stafford and the 9-2 Rams have the best record in the NFC, and coach Sean McVay said after the win, "I love the way that we've handled a little bit of success."

title: 'No quit': Cowboys flex 'grit' in record-tying rally
content: The Cowboys trailed 21-0 against the Eagles but rallied to win 24-21. The 21-point comeback tied a franchise record.

title: Sources: D-II Eastern New Mexico to hire Briles
content: Art Briles, fired by Baylor in 2016 after a review of the Big 12 school's handling of sexual assault allegations made against several football players, is set to take over as coach at Division II Eastern New Mexico, sources confirmed to ESPN on Sunday.

title: Wings again win WNBA draft lottery, to pick No. 1
content: For the second year in a row, the Dallas Wings will select first in the 2026 WNBA draft after winning the draft lottery Sunday.

title: The main thing to know from every Week 12 game: Rams sit atop NFC after Eagles' meltdown
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 12.

title: Sizing up the postseason picture, including every bowl matchup, with one week to go
content: While some teams look like CFP locks, there's still a lot to be determined as the regular season winds down.

title: Superlatives for the 2025-26 MLB free agent class, from Kyle Tucker to Alex Bregman
content: Surprise signings? Slugger or bust? Most impact? We've got a yearbook's worth of awards for the top MLB free agents.

title: What to know about Damon Jones, the man at the center of two NBA scandals
content: After making more than $21 million across 11 seasons in the NBA, the NBA journeyman fell hard -- and, prosecutors allege, into a life of crime.

title: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Early NBA contender questions: How top 16 teams can keep playoff hopes alive
content: Our insiders answer one big question on the top NBA teams with title ambitions and explain what they need to do to stay a contender.

title: First-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Let's take the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Predicting the USMNT's starting lineup at the World Cup: What previous tournaments tell us
content: When the USMNT plays in a World Cup, there are always some locks, and always some players who come out of nowhere to start games.

title: How McLaren's microscopic Vegas DQ brought Max Verstappen into the title fight
content: A technical infraction as small as a hair's width saw both McLarens disqualified from Vegas, which has enormous ramifications for F1's title fight.

title: How Christian McCaffrey became a scrimmage yard king on the verge of NFL history
content: McCaffrey, one of the best receiving running backs in NFL history, plays his former team on "Monday Night Football."

title: From player to GM: Panthers' Dan Morgan, 49ers' John Lynch are in rare air
content: Only two of the 32 GMs played in the league -- and they took drastically different paths to get there.

title: Liverpool are on course to be worst-ever Premier League champions. Can Slot stop the rot?
content: Liverpool spent £450 million in the summer to cement their position as England's dominant force. But after 12 games, their title defence is in chaos.

title: Eze haunts Spurs as Arsenal make statement of title intent
content: Eberechi Eze savored his first North London derby with Arsenal by netting a hat trick against their rivals.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Which team should take Kenyon Sadiq in April?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 13, including why Kenyon Sadiq is TE1 and whether Utah could have two early-pick OTs.

title: Week 12 winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Emanuel Wilson led the way with big Week 12 performances, while Jonathan Taylor, Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson and were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Wilson shines as fill-in for Jacobs; Monangai takes over in Bears' backfield
content: Green Bay's Emanuel Wilson proved why it's critical to insure your top RBs by rostering their backup.

title: Browns use Sanders, Garrett to throw Raiders, topping Week 12's petty posts
content: NFL teams remained petty as the calendar nears the holiday week, but one squad took it to another level.

title: The luck pendulum swings back in favor of the Chiefs but away from the spread
content: Kansas City finally won a one-score game for the first time all season, but other teams weren't so lucky.

title: Valimaki wins first PGA Tour title in season finale
content: Sami Valimaki became Finland's first PGA Tour winner on Sunday when he closed with a 4-under 66 for a one-shot victory in the RSM Classic in St. Simons Island, Georgia, the final event of the year which saw hopes rise and fall over the final hour of play.

title: Jeeno Thitikul sets LPGA mark; wins finale, $4M payday
content: Jeeno Thitikul closed with a 4-under 68 to win the CME Group Tour Championship and set the lowest scoring average in LPGA Tour history.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United ready to hand Onana's squad number to Semenyo
content: Manchester United are hoping they can lure Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo to Old Trafford. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bengaluru Uber Drivers Protest Outside Head Office Over Work Bias
content: Hundreds of cab drivers on Monday staged a major protest outside Uber's head office near Bommanahalli in Bengaluru, accusing the company of discrimination, denial of work, and predatory surge pricing.

title: Generative AI Can Become Modern-Day Frankenstein's Monster, Warns UN Rights Chief
content: The UN on Monday warned that generative AI could become "a modern-day Frankenstein's monster", with human rights the first casualty, as powerful tech giants unleash the technology on the world.

title: Opinion: Opinion | AI Images To Clips, Inside China's 'Disinformation' Campaign Against India
content: Post Operation Sindoor, Chinese operatives used AI-generated images and video game clips, presenting them as debris to claim that Pakistans Chinese-supplied J-10s had shot down Indian Rafales. Here's why.

title: BJP Slams Rahul Gandhi's Absence At Chief Justice Surya Kant's Oath Ceremony
content: Congress leader and the Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi's absence at the oath ceremony of 53rd Chief Justice of india, Justice Surya Kant, has been slammed by the BJP.

title: Adani Portfolio Capex Hits A Robust Rs 67,000 Crore In First Half Of FY26
content: The Adani Portfolio on Monday said it has delivered a stellar financial performance in the first half this fiscal (H1 FY26), clocking a robust capex of Rs 67,870 crore with EBITDA rising to an all-time high of Rs 47,375 crore

title: Toronto Police Arrest Indian-Origin Man On Canada's Most Wanted List
content: Toronto police have arrested an Indian-origin man on "Canada's 25 most wanted list" with firearms and ammunition, police said.

title: Congress' Jairam Ramesh Faces Parliament Panel Over "Cheerleader" Jab At Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: The Rajya Sabha Privileges Committee has taken a "serious view" of the complaint against Congress leader Jairam Ramesh for making "disrespectful allegations" against the then Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar, sources told NDTV on Monday.

title: Chief Justice BR Gavai's 'Mercedes Class Gesture' For Successor
content: Former Chief Justice of India BR Gavai did not use the official black Mercedes-Benz car when he left the Rashtrapati Bhavan after Chief Justice of India Surya Kant took oath, sources said.

title: SIM Holders May Be Held Accountable For Misuse, Warns Telecom Department
content: Mobile subscribers may be held liable if a SIM card procured in their name is found to have been misused for cyber fraud or other illegal activities, an official statement said on Monday.

title: Canada To Tweak Citizenship Rules: How India-Origin Families Will Benefit
content: The Canadian government is planning to bring in a law to end the restrictive "second-generation cut-off" rule, which prevented many Canadian citizens born abroad from passing on citizenship to their children who were also born overseas.

title: Upset Over Parents Not Giving Her Phone, Nagpur Teen Dies By Suicide
content: The girl, a Class 8 student, used to like playing games on mobile phones. When she asked her parents to buy one for her, they refused.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Red Fort To Kashmir: Why Turkey Keeps Coming Up In India's Terror Probes
content: Over the past few years, Turkey has been surfacing frequently in matters inimical to India - whether in support for Pakistan against India, or fuelling Kashmiri separatist sentiment, or peddling narratives of Muslim victimhood in India.

title: "Propaganda": Ex-Tirupati Official On '20 Crore Spurious Ghee Laddoos' Claim
content: Subba Reddy said similar accusations were made during the earlier TDP government, when Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu claimed that animal fat was being used in laddoo preparation.

title: In Pics: Ayodhya Gears Up For Ram Temple's 'Dhwaj Arohan' Event
content: PM Modi will perform the sacred Hindu ritual of 'Dhwaja Arohan' by hoisting a 22-foot religious (dharmic) flag on Tuesday.

title: PM Modi Attends Swearing-In Ceremony Of Justice Surya Kant, Extends Greetings
content: Justice Surya Kant, who has been part of several landmark judgments, was sworn in as the 53rd Chief Justice of India (CJI) on Monday and Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended his greetings and conveyed best wishes for his tenure.

title: Why Gen Z Right Finds A New MAGA Champion In Nikki Haley's Son Nalin Haley
content: Nalin Haley, the 24-year-old son of former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley, is now one of the most popular young voices on the American right.

title: Chartered Accountant Found Dead In Kolkata Hotel Room, 2 Arrested
content: Two people have been arrested after a man was found dead inside his room at a hotel in West Bengal's Kasba area in South 24 Parganas district.

title: Judge Who Sought Favours Dodges In-House Probe With Retirement? Maybe Not
content: A high court chief justice who tried to influence a National Company Law Appellate Tribunal member in Chennai for a ruling in favour of a company has narrowly escaped an in-house inquiry due to his retirement and other reasons.

title: Bengaluru College Student Found Dead In Rented Room, Cops Suspect Murder
content: The victim, identified as Devisri, was a final-year Bachelor of Business Management (BBM) student at Acharya College.

title: COP30: A Decade After Paris, Climate Diplomacy Is About Saving Itself
content: Two weeks of frenzied negotiations over the planet's faltering fight against climate change had come down to this: a pre-dawn battle over shifting away from fossil fuels.

title: Last goodbye to B'woods 'He-Man': Esha Deol breaks down; Big B, Salman attend last rites
content: Bollywood icon Dharmendra passed away at his Mumbai residence on November 24. The legendary actor's cremation was conducted swiftly, with many industry colleagues and family members, including Hema Malini and the Deol family, in attendance to pay their final respects. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu mourned his passing, acknowledging his significant contributions to Indian cinema.

title: Wedding postponed: Smriti removes marriage posts; father, fiancé hospitalised
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has removed all wedding-related posts from her Instagram. This comes as her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, was hospitalised. The wedding ceremony, scheduled for November 23, has been indefinitely postponed. Her manager confirmed the postponement due to Mr Mandhana's health. The couple and families request privacy during this time.

title: Ethiopia volcano ash plumes: IndiGo flight to Abu Dhabi diverts to Ahmedabad
content: Ash plumes from Ethiopia's Hayli Gubbi volcano eruption are moving east. These plumes are expected to reach Delhi and Jaipur. Indian aviation authorities are monitoring the situation closely. Airlines are also watching for potential impacts on flight movements. The ash is currently drifting beyond Oman. Officials hope the intensity will reduce as it travels.

title: 'Does a lot of dishes': Usha Vance reacts to missing ring
content: Second Lady Usha Vance clarified speculation surrounding her marriage after being photographed without her wedding ring. A spokesperson attributed the oversight to her busy role as a mother of three, emphasizing no deeper meaning. This follows recent online scrutiny of Vice President JD Vance's interactions at a conservative event and his comments regarding his wife's religious beliefs.

title: Apple's warning to stores: Foreign SIM = penalty; outlets face closure risk
content: Apple distributors are warning Indian retailers against activating new iPhones, especially the iPhone 17 series, with foreign SIMs within 90 days, citing hefty penalties and store code blocking. This crackdown follows a surge in iPhone 17 models being diverted to high-margin markets like Russia, Africa, and the Middle East, causing domestic shortages. Retailers are pushing back against this mandate, arguing it unfairly targets them.

title: Areas close to waste-to-energy plants have Delhi’s worst air; Okhla, Ghazipur worst hit
content: Residents near Delhi's waste-to-energy plants endure severe pollution, with foul air and acrid odors plaguing their neighborhoods year-round. Despite burning thousands of tons of waste daily and emitting toxic pollutants, these plants are excluded from emergency pollution control measures like GRAP, leaving communities vulnerable to chronic and seasonal health impacts.

title: Siraj’s spidercam prank! Camera operator's response steals the show — Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's lighthearted moment with the Spidercam offered a brief respite for Indian fans amidst a tough day 3 in Guwahati. South Africa dominated, with Marco Jansen's exceptional all-round performance, including 6/48, crippling India's first innings and bundling them out for 201. The Proteas did not enforce the follow-on and opted to bat again.

title: Flipkart Black Friday sale 2025: Offers on phones, laptops are live; check prices
content: Flipkart's Black Friday Sale 2025 is live until November 28, offering significant discounts on electronics like smartphones, TVs, and laptops. Major brands such as Apple and Samsung are featured, with deals extending to home appliances. Other retailers like Vijay Sales and Croma are also participating with their own Black Friday promotions.

title: 'Masks off, real faces out': BJP flays Cong; Hidma posters at pollution stir sparks row
content: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized protesters at India Gate for raising slogans supporting a slain Naxal commander, accusing them of being influenced by "pollution of Marx and Mao." The protest, initially against air pollution, saw demonstrators holding posters of Madvi Hidma, leading to arrests by Delhi Police for obstructing personnel and assaulting them.

title: Feel Low in Winter? Discover the Causes and Symptoms of Seasonal Affective Disorder
content: As winter's shorter days and longer nights arrive, many experience a dip in mood and energy, potentially indicating winter depression, a form of SAD. This condition, linked to light exposure and disrupted circadian rhythms, can be managed with strategies like maximizing sunlight, maintaining routines, and a balanced diet.

title: Dharmendra no more: Hindi cinema loses a legend; nation remembers his golden era
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, Bollywood's 'He-Man', passed away in Mumbai at 89 after a brief illness. Renowned for a prolific career spanning six decades and over 300 films, including the iconic 'Sholay', the legendary actor leaves an indelible mark on Indian cinema. His final film, 'Ikkis', is slated for release next year. Dharmendra's legacy is celebrated for his versatility and charm.

title: OpenAI's internal memo: Altman notes Google’s AI success; calls it 'temporary headwind'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.

title: 'Why? Why? Why?': Angry Mamata shoots off letter to EC; flags 'disturbing' decisions
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has expressed alarm to the Election Commission over two "disturbing" developments concerning the state's election machinery. She questioned the outsourcing of data entry work by the Chief Electoral Officer and the proposal to set up polling booths in private housing complexes, citing concerns about fairness and potential political influence.

title: India hit the Jansen wall again; South Africa closes in on historic series victory
content: India's batting collapsed spectacularly on day three in Guwahati, succumbing to poor decisions and shot selection against South Africa. Despite a pitch described as a 'road', India was bowled out for 201, with Marco Jansen claiming six wickets. South Africa, leading by 314 runs, is poised for a series victory, leaving India hoping for a miracle.

title: Pepper spray, Hidma posters and broken barricades: Protest over Delhi pollution stuns cops
content: A clean-air protest at Delhi's India Gate took a surprising turn as demonstrators displayed posters of slain Maoist commander Madvi Hidma. Police arrested 22 individuals for refusing to disperse, using chilli spray on officers, and blocking traffic. The incident occurred amidst severe air pollution levels plaguing the national capital.

title: School teachers to be mentored by professors: Here’s all about India's NMM initiative
content: The UGC has issued a new advisory asking universities to nominate senior faculty for the National Mission for Mentoring, a programme designed to link experienced academics with schoolteachers. The move aligns with NEP 2020’s plan to build a national mentoring system. Selected professors will guide teachers in pedagogy, digital literacy, foundational learning and other key areas through the NMM portal.

title: Vanes Martirosyan: American boxer dies at 39 after two-year cancer battle
content: Former U.S. Olympic boxer Vanes Martirosyan has passed away at 39 after a two-year fight with cancer. The world title contender, who represented the U.S. at the 2004 Olympics, was diagnosed with skin cancer in 2023. His family confirmed the heartbreaking news, remembering him as a loving husband, father, and kind soul.

title: Kuldeep Yadav sets new mark for most balls faced by an Indian in the series
content: India collapsed to 201 all out on day three of the second Test, conceding a 288-run first-innings lead to South Africa. Despite a good start, the hosts lost wickets rapidly, with only Yashasvi Jaiswal and Washington Sundar offering significant resistance. A late eighth-wicket partnership between Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav provided brief respite.

title: How artificial sweeteners secretly age your brain and memory
content: New research suggests artificial sweeteners, commonly found in diet drinks and sugar-free products, may impact brain health. Studies indicate a link between higher intake and reduced cognitive performance, resembling accelerated brain aging. Scientists are exploring how these sweeteners interact with gut bacteria, inflammation, and neural pathways, urging caution despite regulatory approval for other health aspects.

title: ‘Don't respect Ambedkar, Samvidhan’: BJP slams Rahul for skipping CJI’s oath taking
content: The BJP has criticized Rahul Gandhi for his absence at the oath-taking ceremony of Justice Surya Kant as the new Chief Justice of India. Party spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged Gandhi's boycott showed disrespect to B.R. Ambedkar and the Constitution, suggesting a preference for 'parivaar tantra' over constitutional norms. The event saw the presence of top government dignitaries.

title: Follow-on or not? Bavuma asks for '2 mins'; runs to the dressing room to take call
content: South Africa opted against enforcing the follow-on, leading by a substantial 288 runs. India, bowled out for 201, saw a late fightback from Washington Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav. Marco Jansen was the standout bowler for the Proteas with six wickets, while Simon Harmer chipped in with three.

title: Dharmendra passes away: Jagdeep Sidhu says ‘he lived like a lion’ - Exclusive
content: Bollywood's 'He-Man,' Dharmendra, has passed away at 89. The beloved actor, who inspired generations of Punjabi artists to pursue their dreams in Bombay, breathed his last on Monday, November 24, 2025. His legacy of living fearlessly and earning universal love leaves a profound void.

title: NASA spots a mysterious red sphere hurtling through space at record speed
content: NASA has discovered CWISE J1249, a mysterious red celestial object moving at over one million miles per hour through the Milky Way. This object, with its extremely low mass and unique infrared signature, challenges current theories of stellar and planetary formation. Scientists are investigating if it's a supernova remnant or an ejected planet, as its characteristics defy conventional classification.

title: Kabul invites Indian firms to revive idle mines; industry body calls for caution
content: Afghanistan has invited Indian companies to invest in its vast, untapped mineral resources, including gold and lithium, estimated to be worth $1 trillion. While Indian industry leaders acknowledge the potential, they stress the need for thorough geological surveys and infrastructure development before committing to projects.

title: Rupee watch: Currency nears 90 amid RBI caution; data-heavy week to test stability
content: The Indian rupee faced renewed pressure, nearing a record low of 90 against the US dollar due to portfolio outflows and trade deal doubts. While the rupee rebounded slightly on Monday following central bank intervention and dipping crude prices, key economic data releases this week will be closely watched.

title: Dharmendra passes away: From Salman to Amitabh celebs reach for his funeral
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra has passed away in Mumbai. An ambulance was seen leaving his residence on Monday, November 24. His family has not yet confirmed the news, but Hema Malini, Sunny Deol, and Bobby Deol, were spotted at the Juhu crematorium. Amitabh Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, and Agastya Nanda were also seen.

title: Did Tom Brady just say the N-word live on air?
content: Tom Brady stumbled over a player's name during a live broadcast of the Dallas Cowboys versus Philadelphia Eagles game. The incident occurred in the final minutes of the match. Social media users reacted to the verbal mix-up. Brady is in his second season as a commentator for FOX. The game itself saw Dallas achieve a historic comeback victory.

title: Dharmendra’s emotional post for Siraj resurfaces; reflects his love for cricket
content: Bollywood legend Dharmendra is being remembered for his love of Indian sports. An old post dedicated to fast bowler Mohammed Siraj has resurfaced. Dharmendra praised Siraj's courage after his father's death. Siraj played for India and returned to his father's grave. This act deeply moved the veteran actor. The post highlights Dharmendra's humanity.

title: Living in a parasocial world: When your new 'best friend' is a popular stranger
content: In 2025, 'parasocial' became the word of the year, reflecting a world where emotional bonds with public figures feel like friendships.  From influencers to athletes, this one-sided connection offers comfort and community, blurring lines between fantasy and reality.  This phenomenon, amplified by social media, shapes our modern human experience, bringing both joy and potential pitfalls.

title: IND vs SA: 'Silence stings' - Karun Nair's cryptic post sparks storm as India crumble
content: Karun Nair's cryptic social media update caused quite a stir among fans during India's tumultuous batting display against South Africa. With his impressive domestic performance fresh in everyone's minds and Ashwin joining the dialogue, debates about Nair's absence grew louder.

title: Dharmendra passes away: PM Modi calls it 'end of an era'; offers condolences to Deol family
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu mourned the passing of veteran actor Dharmendra, hailing his "end of an era" contribution to Indian cinema. The 89-year-old actor, known as the 'He-Man of Bollywood', leaves behind a legacy of over 300 films and memorable performances.

title: Chilli spray & Maoist slogans: Delhi pollution protest turns red — what happened on ground
content: Anti-pollution protests in Delhi turned political as demonstrators displayed pro-Maoist posters, leading to over 22 arrests. Police reported protesters used chilli spray on personnel. The BJP labelled them 'professional protesters' and 'urban Naxals.' Meanwhile, Aam Aadmi Party questioned the BJP-led Delhi government's "inaction" on the pollution as the air quality remained "very poor" in the region.

title: 'Isolated occurrence': HAL issues statement on Tejas crash at Dubai airshow
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) described the Tejas aircraft crash in Dubai, which resulted in the death of IAF pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal, as an "isolated occurrence caused by exceptional circumstances." The company assured that the incident has no impact on its business operations or future deliveries, while its shares experienced a significant drop before partially recovering.

title: One mistake can cost Rs 3 lakh: 10 salary negotiation lessons for young professionals
content: A Hyderabad IT professional's viral Reddit post reveals how many early-career tech workers accept lower salaries due to poor negotiation strategies. Lacking preparation and fearing offer withdrawal, candidates often miss out on fair compensation. Industry experts emphasize salary negotiation as a crucial skill, offering a 10-step guide for young professionals to secure better packages and build stronger financial futures.

title: How new labour laws could hit your take-home salary; impact on PF & gratuity decoded
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: Gold outlook: Yellow metal retains shine as global uncertainty fuels record demand
content: Gold is poised for continued strength, acting as a safe haven against global turmoil.  HSBC highlights robust demand from central banks and retail investors, driven by economic and geopolitical uncertainties.  Despite a recent dip from record highs, the precious metal has stabilized, with expectations of further gains fueled by potential US Federal Reserve rate cuts and persistent inflation concerns.

title: 'He can be very effective in ODIs': Irfan Pathan makes bold call for India’s No. 4 slot
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the ODI series against South Africa, with Rishabh Pant and Ruturaj Gaikwad returning. Irfan Pathan believes Tilak Varma, who impressed in the Asia Cup final, deserves a chance at No. 4 in the middle order and could be very effective in ODIs.

title: India–Canada trade talks: Piyush Goyal says negotiations to restart
content: India and Canada are set to resume negotiations on a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, aiming to boost bilateral trade to $50 billion by 2030. This move signals renewed trust and investor confidence, following a period of strained relations. The agreement will explore collaboration in critical minerals, technology, and energy sectors.

title: Tamil Nadu: 6 dead, several injured as two private buses collide head-on in Tenkasi district
content: A tragic head-on collision between two private buses near Idaikal village in Tenkasi district claimed the lives of at least six people, including five women. Several others sustained injuries in the accident on the Thirumangalam-Kollam National Highway. Rescue operations were swiftly initiated, with victims transported to Tenkasi Government Hospital for treatment.

title: Celebrity-packed wedding in Udaipur: All about the host who invited Trump Jr, Jennifer Lopez
content: US entrepreneur Rama Raju Mantena, originally from Vijayawada, is hosting a lavish wedding in Udaipur for his daughter Netra. The event, attended by Donald Trump Jr., features performances by international stars and has heightened security. Mantena, a successful businessman with multiple ventures, is the nephew of former BJP MP Gokaraju Gangaraju.

title: 'Claimed he had a heart attack': Woman used dupatta to strangle husband; lover on run
content: Vadodara police arrested a 25-year-old woman for allegedly murdering her husband, claiming he died of a heart attack. Her suspicious behavior led to an investigation, revealing a conspiracy with her lover and an accomplice who used her dupatta to strangle the victim. The trio had been planning the murder for three months.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal drops sharply; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices experienced a sharp decline on Monday, influenced by a stronger dollar and cautious investor sentiment ahead of key US economic data. Futures trade saw significant drops, with analysts anticipating these indicators will shape the Federal Reserve's December policy. City-wise rates also reflected this downward trend.

title: ‘Go in debt if you have to’: London-based techie cuts short Delhi visit over toxic air
content: A tech professional's stark warning to leave Delhi due to severe air pollution has sparked a heated online debate. While many agree with his health emergency assessment, others highlight the privilege of relocation, emphasizing the need for systemic solutions. Delhi's air quality remains critically poor, raising questions about the city's livability for millions.

title: Double standards? Perth vs Eden Gardens: The pitch paradox explained
content: The two-day Ashes Test in Perth reignited the long-running debate on pitch standards after 32 wickets fell in 141 overs. Indian players and experts questioned the double standards in global criticism of turning tracks. But unlike the underprepared Eden Gardens surface, the Perth pitch improved with time, offered consistent bounce, and allowed Travis Head’s match-defining century, showing that the collapses were due to skillful bowling rather than an unplayable wicket.

title: Where the most chaos could be lurking on Rivalry Week
content: the penultimate week of the college football regular season gave us plenty of entertainment . we got an incredible comeback in Salt Lake City, we got some resounding blowouts and we got the best ending of the season at the Division II level . the ACC gave us more chaos thanks to Georgia Tech's no-show against Pitt .

title: NHL's best this week: The case for a new 'playoff cutoff' date
content: if an NHL team is in a playoff position by American Thanksgiving, they will probably make the playoffs . from 2005-06 through last season, 77.1% of NHL teams on American Thanksgiving made the postseason . this season could be different: in the last 10 seasons, taking out the season that COVID affected the Thanksgiving mark .

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 12: Is the J.J. McCarthy era already coming to an end?
content: the Minnesota Vikings are a good organization, and they made the decision to go all-in on quarterback J.J. McCarthy and ... well... it just has to get better one of these weeks, right? not this week . the Vikings have offensive line issues .

title: Hurts: Meltdown needs to 'light a fire' in Eagles
content: Eagles QB Jalen Hurts and wide receiver DeVonta Smith sat side-by-side at their locker stalls . the players still processing how they let a 21-point lead slip through their fingers . "we've got to own this one, let it light a fire in us as a team and stay together," he said .

title: NFL Week 12's fashionable arrivals, featuring Bucs QB Baker Mayfield
content: week 12 of the season delivered another wave of pregame tunnel looks that matched the stakes on the field . from understated tunnel walks to full-on runway moments, Week 12 delivered a wave of tunnel looks . the last week of football action before Thanksgiving means that November football is in full swing .

title: MLB offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: 🏈 Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: Maharashtra local body elections: 40% BJP candidates to be below 35 years of age, says CM Fadnavis
content: Polls to several civic bodies in the State, including Mumbai, have to be completed before January 31 next year. They have been pending since 2022

title: ECI should protect BLOs, safeguard voters' rights: TMC MP
content: TMC has been vocal in its criticism of the poll panel over reported incidents of death of Booth Level Officers (BLO), particularly in West Bengal

title: BLO issues suicide threat, revenue officials reach out to him
content: Officials visit him at his residence. Two staff members from the Mundakkayam village office have been assigned to assist him

title: Ambayathode action committee leader in hiding contests local body polls on the IUML ticket
content: Submission of nomination by one of the suspects at large has intensified debates over the ongoing police action targeting those involved in the mass protest that turned violent on the poultry waste rendering unit premises on October 21

title: Northeast’s maiden Comic Con India stirs latent pop culture
content: The two-day event in Guwahati was the first such celebration beyond the metropolises and “mainland” cities

title: BLOs protest outside Bengal CEO’s office over ‘excessive’ work pressure under SIR
content: Members of the BLO Adhikar Raksha Committee took out the procession from College Square in north Kolkata, carrying locks and fetters to symbolically close the main entrance of the building in which the office of the Chief Electoral Officer

title: Doddalathur megalithic excavations reveal rare burial practices, rock art in southern Karnataka
content: Although over 40 sites in the belt were first recorded in the 1960s by archaeologist C. Krishnamurthi, the present excavation marks one of the few systematic investigations of such sites undertaken in Karnataka in recent decades

title: Supreme Court to examine plea to stop cash donations even upto ₹2000 to political parties
content: Clause (d) of Section 13A of the Income Tax Act, 1961 allows tax exemption to political parties for cash donations upto ₹2000

title: LDF candidates win unopposed from two more wards in Anthoor municipality
content: The wins came after the returning officer rejected the nomination papers of the United Democratic Front candidates during re-scrutiny after it was found that the signatures in the nomination papers were forged

title: Srisailam temple management urges devotees to do booking only through official websites
content: For any information, devotees can contact the temple information centre on phone numbers 8333901351/52/53, temple trust board chairman and executive officer saids

title: Centre’s additional borrowing stipulations prompt Kerala govt. to ask Electricity Regulatory Commission to “avoid ceiling limit of 10 paise a unit” on fuel surcharge
content: State government makes a specific policy direction to the commission. In May 2023, KSERC commission had fixed 10 paise a unit as maximum surcharge a month after the Centre amended the Electricity Rules to make surcharge recovery by distribution companies an automatic process

title: Over 5 lakh devotees take part in Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary celebrations
content: Superintendent of Police thanks multiple departments for the smooth conduct of the week-long events which saw attendance of national-level leaders

title: BJP should not try to dislodge the Congress government, says MLA Ramesh Jarkiholi
content: Appealing to the BJP leadership to remain neutral where the political situation in Karnataka is concerned, Mr. Jarkiholi likened it to “dirty swamp” and said the BJP should not get into it.

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF manifesto promises to address waste management issue, stray dog menace, and extend special allowance to ASHAs
content: Second phase of ‘Ashraya’ scheme for eradication of poverty, yearly increase of 10% in Plan Fund for local bodies and special fund allocation of 5% for projects to support the youth are among the other key proposals

title: Delhi HC seeks Centre, CBI, ED's response on Christian Michel's plea challenging extradition provision
content: The lawyer said Mr. Michel will complete seven years in jail on December 4, 2025, and he has not been released from prison even once

title: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to visit India in 2026
content: "Prime Minister Carney accepted Prime Minister Modi’s invitation to visit India in early 2026," say statement issued by Canadian Prime Minister's office

title: Six dead, over 35 injured as private buses collide in Tenkasi; CM Stalin announces solatium
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has deputed Minister K.K.S.S.R. Ramachandran, who is also in-charge of Tenkasi district, to rush to the spot to coordinate relief operations.

title: Dharmendra death: Iconic film personality, phenomenal actor, says PM Modi
content: PM Modi said the manner in which Dharmendra played diverse roles struck a chord with countless people.

title: 1983 poll violence: Assam Government to table unofficial Mehta panel report, says CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Prominent citizens have advised against turning the official Tewary Commission Report on the Nellie massacre into a political tool ahead of the 2026 Assembly polls

title: Internally displaced people clash with security forces as they attempt to return to native homes
content: Agitated protesters scuffled with security forces and headed towards the areas considered one of the most sensitive zones, prompting them to fire tear gas shells to disperse them, the official added

title: Madras High Court to examine the legality of film financiers charging 30% interest rate for loans
content: A Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq say the quantum, prima facie, appears to be exorbitant and usurious

title: NTK chief Seeman booked for ‘threatening’ journalist in Puducherry
content: Several journalists’ associations have come out strongly against the behaviour of Mr. Seeman at the press conference.

title: Rabri Devi alleges bias, seeks transfer of CBI, ED cases to another court
content: Devi is named as an accused in four cases, including the land-for-jobs and IRCTC scam case, which are being heard by Special Judge Vishal Gogne

title: CJI Surya Kant to head Supreme Court Collegium after predecessor Justice Gavai demits office
content: Besides CJI Kant, the five-member Collegium would now comprise CJI Kant and Justices Vikram Nath, B.V. Nagarathna, J.K. Maheshwari and M.M. Sundresh

title: Ex-CJI Gavai leaves official car for successor Surya Kant at Rashtrapati Bhavan
content: “After the oath ceremony, Justice Gavai left the official vehicle designated for the chief justice and returned in an alternative vehicle from the Rashtrapati Bhavan,” a source said

title: 53rd CJI Surya Kant: Congratulations pour in
content: “Confident constitutional values will be further reinforced under Justice Kant's leadership,” Mr. Kharge said

title: Yogi Adityanath directs District Magistrates and Senior Superintendents of Police to address citizens complaint promptly
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath emphasised that officers must ensure the timely redressal of complaints across all departments

title: Delhi riots case hearing updates: Supreme Court adjourns hearing to December 2
content: Umar Khalid, other accused are seeking bail after five years in jail as undertrials; Delhi police say violence was pre-planned

title: SIR row: Opposition making noise because 'they have something to hide', says Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM
content: "The parties making noise over the SIR of voter lists have 'something to hide'. Bihar has proved that their position is weak," says U.P. Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya

title: Northeast monsoon strengthens in south Tamil Nadu
content: In the past 24 hours ending at 6 a.m. on November 24, Tirunelveli district received an average rainfall of 93.96 mm, with several catchment areas experiencing extremely heavy rainfall.

title: 'Detonated at main gate ': How suicide bombers targeted paramilitary force HQ in Pakistan
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Assess ecological implications of proposed elevated corridor in Kaziranga, UNESCO urged
content: A central Assam resident says the UN body should request the governments of India and Assam to suspend the 35.45-km project until a thorough evaluation is completed

title: More Karnataka Congress legislators backing Shivakumar travel to Delhi
content: According to sources, at least six legislators have landed in the national capital on Sunday (November 23) night.

title: Assam approves Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) Policy 2025
content: The decisions aimed at positioning Assam as the leading aviation MRO hub of Northeast India by 2030 and strengthening Assam's education framework

title: TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Aadhav Arjuna appear for CBI questioning in Karur stampede case
content: Accompanied by party Karur West district secretary K.P. Mathiyazhagan and functionary M.C. Pounraj, they arrived at the camp office of the CBI team in Karur

title: Synergy is armed forces' strength, Operation Sindoor apt example: Army chief
content: “In the age of multi-domain operations, the country's ability to act in concert from the depths of the ocean to the highest frontier will determine the security influence of the Indian republic,” say Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi

title: Congress takes swipe at PM Modi over Rupee's 'freefall'
content: The Rupee had plunged 98 paise to close at its lifetime low of 89.66 against the U.S. dollar on November 21

title: Mushrooming coaching centres: Parliamentary panel to examine trend, existing legislations
content: There have been cases of students enrolled in coaching institutes ending their lives in recent years due to study pressure, with several cases reported in Rajasthan's Kota city alone

title: Where does road dust settle in India’s efforts to clean its air?
content: Dust pollution is mainly caused by unscientific practices during road development and maintenance. The collected dust is typically discarded in landfills or on roadsides, wherefrom the wind easily carries it back into cities, rendering the entire sweeping process ineffective

title: Man sleeping in parked car on ORR charred to death as vehicle catches fire
content: Preliminary findings suggest he pulled over, applied the handbrake and reclined the seat, possibly switching on the heater before falling asleep

title: Who is Justice Surya Kant, the 53rd Chief Justice of India?
content: Justice Surya Kant will remain in the post for nearly 15 months. He will demit office on February 9, 2027 on attaining the age of 65 years

title: Maharashtra Minister’s PA booked for ‘abetting wife’s suicide’
content: “Palve's family has alleged that she took the extreme step following torture and harassment by Mr. Garje and demanded a thorough investigation,” say police

title: Indian Navy commissions indigenous anti-submarine warfare vessel INS Mahe
content: The ship is designed to hunt submarines, conduct coastal patrols, and secure India's vital maritime approaches

title: Three held in Uttarakhand for transporting youngsters to Myanmar to force them into cybercrime
content: Preliminary investigations revealed that Indian agents contacted the victims in person or through mobile applications such as Telegram and WhatsApp, and after extorting money, sent them to Bangkok.

title: Non-government panel’s report on Assam Agitation to be tabled in Assembly, says Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Sarma claimed that it would be first time a report from a commission formed by non-government agencies would be tabled in the Assembly

title: Sonam Wangchuk's plea challenging NSA detention adjourned to December 8
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to hear today a plea filed by Sonam Wangchuk's wife which termed the climate activist's detention under the stringent National Security Act as illegal.

title: PM Modi returns from a three-day visit to South Africa
content: At the G20 Leaders Summit, the Prime Minister called for a global compact to prevent misuse of artificial intelligence and made a strong pitch for critical techniques to be human-centric

title: How can State PSCs be reformed? | Explained
content: How did the Montagu Chelmsford report lead to the establishment of present-day  Public Service Commissions? What is the role of the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions? Is a periodical review of the examination syllabi necessary?

title: Kerala local body polls: Jewellery hub of Koduvally has many Independents in the fray
content: The Indian Union Muslim League stronghold is often in the news for the Communist Party of India (Marxist)’s [CPI(M)] unique experiment of fielding a high number of Independent candidates

title: Kerala local body polls: Human-wildlife conflict emerges as a key poll narrative across forest-fringe regions
content: The issue affects 273 grama panchayats, with 30 of these classified as severe conflict zones, according to a Forest dept. study. While the LDF claims to have taken several steps to mitigate the problem, the UDF and NDA differ and see the Wild Life Protection (Kerala Amendment) Bill, 2025 as a poll ploy

title: Tamil Nadu rains highlights: Several districts announce holidays
content: With the Northeast monsoon intensifying in southern districts, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, and Kanniyakumari districts have been experiencing widespread rainfall

title: Congress will not support four new ‘anti-national’ labour codes: K Muraleedharan slams Centre
content: Mr. Murleedharan claimed that under the new codes, labourers can form an organisation only if at least 10% of its members are part of it; he called this provision incorrect, saying that forming a union is a workers' right.

title: 13 new amphibians recorded from northeast
content: This is the highest number of vertebrate species described in a single publication in over a decade in India

title: Several T.N. districts announce holiday in schools due to rain
content: With the Northeast monsoon intensifying in southern districts, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, and Kanniyakumari districts have been experiencing widespread rainfall

title: What Gen Z is really talking about when they talk politics
content: Among all the Gen Zers this reporter spoke to, one thing was irrefutable: they get their news from social media, absorbing the gist before swiping on. Some, however, do gravitate towards long-form pieces through newspapers and digital subscriptions

title: CM Revanth reviews arrangements for Telangana Rising Global Summit
content: The Chief Minister directs officials to ensure all arrangements meet international standards, stating that the summit will attract delegates from across the world

title: Congress panel consults leaders of TNCC on seat-sharing with DMK
content: AICC in-charge of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, Girish Chodankar said the meeting was to understand the party’s strength and weaknesses, how to approach the assembly elections and alliance partners.

title: Motorists seek adequate safety measures on new ROB in Ranipet town to prevent accidents
content: Originally given its nod in 2019, the new bridge is jointly done by the Southern Railway and the National Highways (NH) wing of State Highways.

title: Tipra Motha Chief warns Minister amid recent political violence in Tripura
content: Tipra Motha Chief Pradyot Kishore Debbarman accuses a Minister of inciting violence and also “taking money from a vested quarter to divide the indigenous people”

title: Dynasty politics and votes: The family packs of Bihar
content: The Bihar Assembly election threw family members of politicians into the limelight. The sons and daughters of MPs and MLAs say they have been elected based on their potential and their work

title: Indigenous presence stronger in 103 Assembly seats: Assam BJP
content: The party has attributed this to the delimitation exercise of 2023 to ensure political safeguards for the State’s indigenous communities

title: J&K doctors’ bodies condemn blast near Red Fort, terms medics involvement ‘deeply disturbing’
content: The Doctors Association Jammu termed the involvement of doctors in terror as a “complete betrayal of the Hippocratic Oath and an insult to the noble medical profession”

title: Residents call for tighter regulation of waste plants under GRAP norms in Delhi
content: Even during GRAP III restrictions, which curb industrial activity, these waste plants continue operating because they are classified as “essential services”.

title: India, Italy announce joint initiative for co-op in combating financing of terrorism as PM Modi meets Meloni
content: During the meeting on the sidelines of the G20 summit, the two leaders adopted the India-Italy Joint Initiative to Counter Financing of Terrorism, which reiterates their common resolve to fight terrorism

title: Kochi may see more fever casesas weather patterns change
content: A total of 9,848 fever cases were reported in the month up to November 18, 2025, according to Health department statistics

title: Rejection of nominations deals a blow to parties in Ernakulam
content: Cong. has taken the biggest hit with 4 of its official candidates losing chance to contest; DCC chief alleges that election officials colluded with ruling LDF to reject the party’s candidates’ nominations

title: U.S. tech majors oppose Indian telcos’ demand to allocate spectrum in 6 GHz band for mobile services
content: The tech majors sought the entire 6GHz band to be allocated for Wi-Fi services instead, as the technical and commercial readiness is not established for mobile services

title: Satish Jarkiholi and Parameshwara send a political message by saying Congress came to power due to team effort
content: In what is being seen as a bid to undermine Deputy Chief Minister and KPCC president D.K Shivakumar, two of his Cabinet colleagues, Satish Jarkiholi and G. Parameshwara on Sunday said that the Congress came to power owing to a team effort

title: How gels and shampoos move: Raman Research Institute builds a device to see it in action
content: This, the Raman Research Institute team explained, matters because many real-world products and industrial chemicals, from oil-recovery fluids to cosmetic gels, belong to a group known as non-Newtonian fluids and unlike water or cooking oil, these materials do not let objects glide smoothly through them.

title: Depression over the Bay likely on November 24, no heavy rainfall warnings for State
content: The IMD forecasts the system may intensify into a cyclone by November 26 but has not specified which coastal States could be affected. Andhra Pradesh currently has no heavy rainfall or fishermen warnings

title: PM Modi departs Johannesburg after concluding his engagements at G-20 Leaders’ Summit
content: Modi on Sunday met his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney, Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, Italian premier Giorgia Meloni, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and his counterparts from Jamaica and the Netherlands

title: Udupi MLA threatens stir over incomplete district govt. hospital project
content: Yashpal Suvarna, Udupi MLA, has threatened that he will lead a protest if the State government did not complete the ₹146-crore new 250-bed district government hospital project at Ajjarakadu in Udupi by January 15, 2026

title: Unrealistic targets, missed meals, no toilets: Booth Level Officers across T.N. say SIR work causes immense stress
content: BLOs, mainly women, have been having a tough time after being deputed as BLOs for the SIR work in the State. They feel it’s a race against time to complete the process while managing their regular employment and other responsibilities
